title: tribal? sans serif clean font
author: mightyquinn

comments.content:
I found a font named **Snootchie Bootchies** which looks like a good match - only /T is a bit different.  
The copyright says "Rev. Josh Wilhelm 2000" but I don't have any other info and I can't find any legitimate source to acquire it.

If you want to check the old catalogs, the only one on your list that I have is Letraset 1985. A quick glance through it did not show a match.  
Don

"Snootchie Bootchies" must mean something to the English. Here as the phrase in the famous "Keep Calm" poster format [http://www.keepcalm-o-matic.co.uk/p/snootchie-bootchies/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317173912/http:/www.keepcalm-o-matic.co.uk/p/snootchie-bootchies/ "http://www.keepcalm-o-matic.co.uk/p/snootchie-bootchies/")  
Don

WOW! Thank You very much. I did some searching and downloaded it from what-font.co.uk. I do remember that T being "not wanted" and "fixed" as per the boss but I do not remember that name. It certainly would have stood out just like "Belching up Salisbury Steak" which I used to sneak in art files as live text just so some artist or out-putter would have to call me and ask for the font. As it turns out in my searching I came across Jsh Wilhelm and an association with "Spork Thug Typography" on 1001freefonts.com along with a few others. He apparently is very creative with his names and guess what? He is responsible for Belching up salisbury steak! crazy!!!! Thank You very Much!!!
